name: Kotlin
title: A quick reference cheatsheet for Kotlin that includes usage, examples, and more.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: A quick reference cheatsheet for Kotlin that includes usage, examples, and more.

cards.title: main()
main()
cards.body: The main() function is the starting point of every Kotlin program and must be included in the code before execution

cards.title: Print statement
cards.code:
println("Greetings, earthling!")
print("Take me to ")
print("your leader.")

/*
Print:
Greetings, earthling!
Take me to your leader.
*/

cards.title: Notes
cards.code:
// this is a single line comment

/*
this
note
for
many
*/

cards.title: Execution order
Mutable variables
cards.code:
var age = 25
age = 26

cards.title: Immutable variables
cards.code: val goldenRatio = 1.618

cards.title: Type inference
String concatenation
cards.code:
var streetAddress = "123 Main St."
var cityState = "Brooklyn, NY"

println(streetAddress + " " + cityState)
// Print: 123 Main St. Brooklyn, NY

cards.title: String Templates
Built-in Properties and Functions
Character escape
cards.body:
```kotlin {.wrap}
print("\"Excellent!\" I cried. \"Elementary,\" said he.")

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body: // Print: "Excellent!" I cried. "Elementary," said he.

cards.title: Character escape
cards.code:
- `\n` insert new line
- `\t` inserts a tab
- `\r` inserts carriage return
- `\'` inserts a single quote
- `\"` inserts a double quote
- `\\` inserts a backslash
- `\$` inserts a dollar sign

### Arithmetic Operators

```kotlin
5 + 7  // 12
9 -2   // 7
8 *4   // 32
25 /5  // 5
31 % 2 // 1

cards.title: Character escape
cards.body: `+` addition, `-` subtraction, `*` multiplication, `/` division, and `%` modulus

cards.title: Enhanced assignment operator
Increment and decrement operators
cards.code:
var year = 2019
year++   // 2020
year--   // 2019

cards.title: If expression
Else-expression
Else-If expressions
Comparison Operators
cards.code:
var myAge = 19
var sisterAge = 11
var cousinAge = 11

myAge > sisterAge  // true
myAge < cousinAge  // false
myAge >= cousinAge // true
myAge <= sisterAge // false

cards.title: Logical Operators
AND operator: &&
Or operator:||
NOT operator
cards.code:
var hungry = true
var full = false

println(!hungry) // false
println(!full)   // true

cards.title: Evaluation order
cards.code:
!true && (false || true) // false
/*
(false || true) is evaluated first to return true.
Then, evaluate !true && true and return the final result false
*/

!false && true || false // true
/*
!false is evaluated first to return true.
Then true && true is evaluated, returning true.
then, true || evaluates to false and eventually returns true
*/

cards.title: Nested conditions
When expression
Range operator
cards.body:
```kotlin {.wrap}
var height = 46 // inches

cards.title: Range operator
Range operator
cards.code:
### Equality Operators

```kotlin
var myAge = 22
var sisterAge = 21

myAge == sisterAge // false
myAge != sisterAge // true

cards.title: Nullable vs Not-Nullable
cards.code:
var a: String = "Kotlin" // a can never be null
a = null // compilation error
var b: String? = "Kotlin" // b can be null
b = null // ok

cards.title: Safe-Calls
cards.code:
val a = "Kotlin"
val b: String? = null
println(a.length) // can be called safely, because a is never null
println(b?.length) // b?.length returns the length of b, or null if b is null
println(a?.length) // Unnecessary safe call

cards.title: Chaining Safe-Calls
cards.code: bob?.department?.head?.name // chain returns null if any property is null

cards.title: Elvis Operator
Not Null Assertion Operator
cards.code: val l = b!!.length // throws a NullPointerException, if b is null

cards.title: Immutable list
cards.body:
```kotlin {.wrap}
var programmingLanguages = listOf("C#", "Java", "Kotlin", "Ruby")

cards.title: Immutable list
Access List
cards.body:
```kotlin {.wrap}
var cars = listOf("BMW", "Ferrari", "Volvo", "Tesla")

cards.title: Access List
cards.body: println(cars[2]) // Prints: Volvo

cards.title: Access List
List Manipulation
List Manipulation
List Manipulation
Mutable Sets
cards.body:
```kotlin {.wrap}
var womenInTech = mutableSetOf("Ada Lovelace", "Grace Hopper", "Radia Perlman", "Sister Mary Kenneth Keller")

cards.title: Mutable Sets
Immutable Map
cards.body:
```kotlin {.wrap}
var averageTemp = mapOf("winter" to 35,  "spring" to 60,  "summer" to 85, "fall" to 55)

cards.title: Immutable Map
Retrieve map keys and values
cards.body:
```kotlin {.wrap}
var oscarWinners = mutableMapOf("Parasite" to "Bong Joon-ho", "Green Book" to "Jim Burke", "The Shape Of Water" to "Guillermo del Toro")

cards.title: Retrieve map keys and values
cards.body:
println(oscarWinners.keys)
// Prints: [Parasite, Green Book, The Shape Of Water]
